children.contents: Apply the shoelace formula by multiplying the x-coordinate of each vertex by the y-coordinate of the next vertex, summing these products, and subtracting the sum of the products of the y-coordinate of each vertex multiplied by the x-coordinate of the next vertex. Then take the absolute value of the result and divide by 2.
